1. "He opened the door and saw that it was raining outside" — This is logical; he checks the weather.
2. "He decided to go back inside and wait until it stopped raining" — This follows naturally from seeing it’s raining.
3. "He put on his coat and went outside" — This contradicts the previous decision. If he decided to wait inside, he would not then go outside.

The final sentence contradicts the logical flow of the narrative.

Therefore, the order does not make sense.
